text: The coverage increased and the plotting code is simplified: this is great. I'll give more feedback after running the examples.
I have addressed all the comments (finally!). I am merging this. Hurray! Thanks for all the comments and reviews, and thanks to @chrisfilo for the great work.

Thanks, this is really useful
Just one little issue: nosetests now spits out a large number of 
matplotlib figues. It would be great if we can avoid it ?
Is it really necessary for a single image? I have the impression that we have some complicated code here to win a bunch of milliseconds.

text: updated the simple ICA example with new plotting functions
Move 4D fix to slicer, minor other fixes
updated plot ROI extraction to new plotting functions
BUG: avoid having views of data in plots
ENH: lighten the localizer simple loader
updated CanICA to new plotting routines
converted simple nifti example to new plotting API
Deal with nans and cut better
Better cut heuristic and corresponding tests
converted Haxby searchlight example to new plotting API
Removed code dealing with NaNs from the haxby searchlight example

ENH: better cutting heuristic

* Deal properly with flat regions
* Adapt the spacing to the size of the image

Typically these changes are important for the plot_nifti_simple.py file
ENH: meaningful error for wrong display_mode
converted mask_computation to new plotting API
Merge branch 'viz' of github.com:GaelVaroquaux/nilearn into viz
Switched default colormap for ROI/mask to gist_ncar
Ward clustering example with new plotting API
Convert Haxby ANOVA/SVM exmaple to new plotting API
BUG: fix resampling when target_shape is not a tuple
fixes for adjusting figure size for colorbar
ENH: Black bg working on all slices
flip colorbar and align to right
Added right marging to the colorbar
Updated demo with edges and contours.
ENH: add a close method to the slicers

MISC: PEP8, docstring, and less data download

Addresses comments by @bthirion

Merge branch 'master' into viz
